017package org.apache.commons.chain.impl;
018
019import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertEquals;
020import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertFalse;
021import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertInstanceOf;
022import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNotEquals;
023import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNotNull;
024import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNull;
025import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertTrue;
026import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.fail;
027
028import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
029import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
030import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
031import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
032import java.util.ArrayList;
033import java.util.Collection;
034import java.util.HashMap;
035import java.util.Iterator;
036import java.util.Map;
037import java.util.Set;
038
039import org.apache.commons.chain.Context;
040import org.junit.jupiter.api.AfterEach;
041import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
042import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
043
044/**
045 * Test case for the {@code ContextBase} class.
046 *
047 * @author Craig R. McClanahan
048 * @version $Revision$ $Date$
049 */
050public class ContextBaseTestCase<C extends Context> {
051
052    // ---------------------------------------------------- Instance Variables
053
054    /**
055     * The {@link Context} instance under test.
056     */
057    protected C context = null;
058
059    // -------------------------------------------------- Overall Test Methods
060
061    /**
062     * Set up instance variables required by this test case.
063     */
064    @BeforeEach
065    public void init() {
066        context = createContext();
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Tear down instance variables required by this test case.
071     */
072    @AfterEach
073    public void tearDown() {
074        context = null;
075    }
076
077    // ------------------------------------------------ Individual Test Methods
078
079    /**
080     * Test ability to get, put, and remove attributes
081     */
082    @Test
083    public void testAttributes() {
084        Object value = null;
085        checkAttributeCount(0);
086
087        context.put("foo", "This is foo");
088        checkAttributeCount(1);
089        value = context.get("foo");
090        assertNotNull(value, "Returned foo");
091        assertInstanceOf(String.class, value, "Returned foo type");
092        assertEquals("This is foo", value,
093                     "Returned foo value");
094
095        context.put("bar", "This is bar");
096        checkAttributeCount(2);
097        value = context.get("bar");
098        assertNotNull(value, "Returned bar");
099        assertInstanceOf(String.class, value, "Returned bar type");
100        assertEquals("This is bar", value,
101                     "Returned bar value");
102
103        context.put("baz", "This is baz");
104        checkAttributeCount(3);
105        value = context.get("baz");
106        assertNotNull(value, "Returned baz");
107        assertInstanceOf(String.class, value, "Returned baz type");
108        assertEquals("This is baz", value,
109                     "Returned baz value");
110
111        context.put("baz", "This is new baz");
112        checkAttributeCount(3); // Replaced, not added
113        value = context.get("baz");
114        assertNotNull(value, "Returned baz");
115        assertInstanceOf(String.class, value, "Returned baz type");
116        assertEquals("This is new baz", value,
117                     "Returned baz value");
118
119        context.remove("bar");
120        checkAttributeCount(2);
121        assertNull(context.get("bar"),
122                   "Did not return bar");
123        assertNotNull(context.get("foo"),
124                      "Still returned foo");
125        assertNotNull(context.get("baz"),
126                      "Still returned baz");
127
128        context.clear();
129        checkAttributeCount(0);
130        assertNull(context.get("foo"),
131                   "Did not return foo");
132        assertNull(context.get("bar"),
133                   "Did not return bar");
134        assertNull(context.get("baz"),
135                   "Did not return baz");
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Test {@code containsKey()} and {@code containsValue()}
140     */
141    @Test
142    public void testContains() {
143        assertFalse(context.containsKey("bop"));
144        assertFalse(context.containsValue("bop value"));
145        context.put("bop", "bop value");
146        assertTrue(context.containsKey("bop"));
147        assertTrue(context.containsValue("bop value"));
148        context.remove("bop");
149        assertFalse(context.containsKey("bop"));
150        assertFalse(context.containsValue("bop value"));
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Test {@code equals()} and {@code hashCode()}
155     */
156    @Test
157    public void testEquals() {
158        // Compare to self
159        assertTrue(context.equals(context));
160        assertEquals(context.hashCode(), context.hashCode());
161
162        // Compare to equivalent instance
163        Context other = createContext();
164        assertTrue(context.equals(other));
165        assertEquals(context.hashCode(), other.hashCode());
166
167        // Compare to non-equivalent instance - other modified
168        other.put("bop", "bop value");
169        assertFalse(context.equals(other));
170        assertNotEquals(context.hashCode(), other.hashCode());
171
172        // Compare to non-equivalent instance - self modified
173        other = createContext(); // reset to equivalence
174        context.put("bop", "bop value");
175        assertFalse(context.equals(other));
176        assertNotEquals(context.hashCode(), other.hashCode());
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Test {@code keySet()}
181     */
182    @Test
183    public void testKeySet() {
184        Set<String> keySet = null;
185        Collection<String> all = new ArrayList<>();
186
187        // Unsupported operations
188        keySet = context.keySet();
189        try {
190            keySet.add("bop");
191            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
192        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
193            ; // Expected result
194        }
195        try {
196            Collection<String> adds = new ArrayList<>();
197            adds.add("bop");
198            keySet.addAll(adds);
199            fail("Should have thrown UnsupportedOperationException");
200        } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
201            ; // Expected result
202        }
203
204        // Before-modification checks
205        keySet = context.keySet();
206        assertEquals(createContext().size(), keySet.size());
207        assertFalse(keySet.contains("foo"));
208        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bar"));
209        assertFalse(keySet.contains("baz"));
210        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bop"));
211
212        // Add the new elements
213        context.put("foo", "foo value");
214        context.put("bar", "bar value");
215        context.put("baz", "baz value");
216        all.add("foo");
217        all.add("bar");
218        all.add("baz");
219
220        // After-modification checks
221        keySet = context.keySet();
222        assertEquals(expectedAttributeCount() + 3, keySet.size());
223        assertTrue(keySet.contains("foo"));
224        assertTrue(keySet.contains("bar"));
225        assertTrue(keySet.contains("baz"));
226        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bop"));
227        assertTrue(keySet.containsAll(all));
228
229        // Remove a single element via remove()
230        context.remove("bar");
231        all.remove("bar");
232        keySet = context.keySet();
233        assertEquals(expectedAttributeCount() + 2, keySet.size());
234        assertTrue(keySet.contains("foo"));
235        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bar"));
236        assertTrue(keySet.contains("baz"));
237        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bop"));
238        assertTrue(keySet.containsAll(all));
239
240        // Remove a single element via keySet.remove()
241        keySet.remove("baz");
242        all.remove("baz");
243        keySet = context.keySet();
244        assertEquals(expectedAttributeCount() + 1, keySet.size());
245        assertTrue(keySet.contains("foo"));
246        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bar"));
247        assertFalse(keySet.contains("baz"));
248        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bop"));
249        assertTrue(keySet.containsAll(all));
250
251        // Remove all elements via keySet.clear()
252        keySet.clear();
253        all.clear();
254        assertEquals(expectedAttributeCount(), keySet.size());
255        assertFalse(keySet.contains("foo"));
256        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bar"));
257        assertFalse(keySet.contains("baz"));
258        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bop"));
259        assertTrue(keySet.containsAll(all));
260
261        // Add the new elements #2
262        context.put("foo", "foo value");
263        context.put("bar", "bar value");
264        context.put("baz", "baz value");
265        all.add("foo");
266        all.add("bar");
267        all.add("baz");
268
269        // After-modification checks #2
270        keySet = context.keySet();
271        assertEquals(expectedAttributeCount() + 3, keySet.size());
272        assertTrue(keySet.contains("foo"));
273        assertTrue(keySet.contains("bar"));
274        assertTrue(keySet.contains("baz"));
275        assertFalse(keySet.contains("bop"));
276        assertTrue(keySet.containsAll(all));
277    }
278
279    /**
280     * Test state of newly created instance
281     */
282    @Test
283    public void testPristine() {
284        checkAttributeCount(0);
285        assertNull(context.get("foo"),
286                   "No 'foo' attribute");
287    }
288
289    /**
290     * Test {@code putAll()}
291     */
292    @Test
293    public void testPutAll() {
294        // Check preconditions
295        checkAttributeCount(0);
296        assertNull(context.get("foo"));
297        assertNull(context.get("bar"));
298        assertNull(context.get("baz"));
299        assertFalse(context.containsKey("foo"));
300        assertFalse(context.containsKey("bar"));
301        assertFalse(context.containsKey("baz"));
302        assertFalse(context.containsValue("foo value"));
303        assertFalse(context.containsValue("bar value"));
304        assertFalse(context.containsValue("baz value"));
305
306        // Call putAll()
307        Map<String, String> adds = new HashMap<>();
308        adds.put("foo", "foo value");
309        adds.put("bar", "bar value");
310        adds.put("baz", "baz value");
311        context.putAll(adds);
312
313        // Check postconditions
314        checkAttributeCount(3);
315        assertEquals("foo value", context.get("foo"));
316        assertEquals("bar value", context.get("bar"));
317        assertEquals("baz value", context.get("baz"));
318        assertTrue(context.containsKey("foo"));
319        assertTrue(context.containsKey("bar"));
320        assertTrue(context.containsKey("baz"));
321        assertTrue(context.containsValue("foo value"));
322        assertTrue(context.containsValue("bar value"));
323        assertTrue(context.containsValue("baz value"));
324    }
325
326    /**
327     * Test serialization
328     *
329     * @throws Exception any error
330     */
331    @Test
332    public void testSerialization() throws Exception {
333        // Set up the context with some parameters
334        context.put("foo", "foo value");
335        context.put("bar", "bar value");
336        context.put("baz", "baz value");
337        checkAttributeCount(3);
338
339        // Serialize to a byte array
340        ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
341        ObjectOutputStream oos = new ObjectOutputStream(baos);
342        oos.writeObject(context);
343        oos.close();
344
345        // Deserialize back to a new object
346        ByteArrayInputStream bais =
347            new ByteArrayInputStream(baos.toByteArray());
348        ObjectInputStream ois = new ObjectInputStream(bais);
349        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
350        C newContext = (C) ois.readObject();
351        context = newContext;
352        ois.close();
353
354        // Do some rudimentary checks to make sure we have the same contents
355        assertTrue(context.containsKey("foo"));
356        assertTrue(context.containsKey("bar"));
357        assertTrue(context.containsKey("baz"));
358        checkAttributeCount(3);
359    }
360
361    // -------------------------------------------------------- Support Methods
362
363    /**
364     * Verify the number of defined attributes
365     *
366     * @param expected the expected value
367     */
368    protected void checkAttributeCount(int expected) {
369        int actual = 0;
370        Iterator<String> keys = context.keySet().iterator();
371        while (keys.hasNext()) {
372            keys.next();
373            actual++;
374        }
375        assertEquals(expectedAttributeCount() + expected, actual,
376                     "Correct attribute count");
377        if (expected == 0) {
378            assertTrue(context.isEmpty(), "Context should be empty");
379        } else {
380            assertFalse(context.isEmpty(), "Context should not be empty");
381        }
382    }
383
384    /**
385     * Create a new instance of the appropriate Context type for this test case
386     *
387     * @return the new instance of the appropriate Context type
388     */
389    protected C createContext() {
390        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
391        C ret = (C) new ContextBase();
392        return ret;
393    }
394
395    /**
396     * Return the expected {@code size()} for a Context for this test case
397     *
398     * @return the expected {@code size()} for a Context
399     */
400    protected int expectedAttributeCount() {
401        return createContext().size();
402    }
403}
